text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

After we made Pokèball Parfaits, I got so
many requests from you guys

for another fun and easy breakfast recipe
and I thought…
Hmmmm, I got something easy mode… Eggos!

I love Eggos, and today we’re gonna be making,
Emoji Eggos.
Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: Eggos!
These come in different

types and flavors, you can get them in whole wheat
or buttermilk, whatever you’d like.

And then to decorate, you’ll also need fresh
bananas, strawberries,

blueberries, cutting board, cutting knife
and some milk chocolates.

And then over here I have 3 different cookie
cutters, we have a small heart,

little bit larger heart an oval, a few pieces
of wax paper, and I printed
out a few of my favorite Emojis.
Now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is we’re
gonna make our chocolate

facial features. Over here I’ve just heated
up our melted chocolates,

and I’ve put it into a plastic baggie with
a number 4 tip.

This part is totally optional, you can just
pour the chocolate into a

plastic baggie and cut the tip, making a small
incision. But, I’m doing
this for a little bit more control.

And then over here I have our little Emoji
templates, and look! I printed

them to be about the size of an Eggo, so that
we’ll know how big to make

the facial features when we’re putting ‘em
all together.

So I’ve just placed it here, on top of a
cutting board, I didn’t tape it down
because this is super easy mode!

Then you’re gonna take a piece of wax paper,
place it on top, and now

I’m gonna trace all of the little features.
I’m gonna trace eyes, mouths
eyebrows, and even some little sunglasses.

You can also use a toothpick to smooth out
the chocolate and your designs.

Once you’ve made your chocolate designs
we’re just gonna push these out of the

way, woooop! Let them sit for a few minutes
while we are toasting our Eggos!

And I’m just gonna pop them into my toasted,
and I’ve set my toaster

setting on a 4, that’s a 4 out of 10, because
I like to have them a little golden

brown, I don’t like super-crispy, I like
golden brown, but you can

toast them to however crispy you’d like.
While our Eggos are heating up,

we’re gonna prepare our fruit. Over here
I’m gonna first cut the

strawberries, so you’re gonna just take
a fresh strawberry, and you’re

just gonna cut off the top, And then we’re gonna
cut it in 1/2.
Then we’re gonna take our little heart, we’re gonna cut him out!

For the Emojis I've picked, I only need 1 small
heart, 2 large hearts

and an oval. Look at that! It looks like the
little love one!

Oooh! Hot off the press, we’re just gonna put
these on a plate, and I’m gonna

put a couple more in because I’m gonna be
making five designs today.
And then we're gonna cut some banana pennies.

I put the Eggos onto individual plates and now
I am going to decorate

and assemble. I’m so excited, this is my
favorite part.

Here’s all of our little Emoji Faces, and
now it’s gonna come all together!
Alright, I’m gonna start with the cool shades…
Oh my gosh he looks so cute!

Here’s the little embarrassed face, oh my
gosh, look at him!

I’m gonna do my little favorite, I’m gonna
take 2 of my matching
heart strawberries and a little mouth.
Ah there he is!
Ta-da!

Here are the Emoji themed Eggos that we made
today!

A big thank you to you guys for suggesting
another easy mode breakfast

recipe. I love making these because, you can
make whatever Emoji Face you want.

We’re got cool sunglass guy, heart eyes,
kissy face, Mmm-mmmm-mmmm-mmm!

This little embarrassed face, which, I pretty
much…. I relate to this
guy so much, I do this everyday.
And this guy!

Let me know in the comments below what your
favorite Emoji face is,

and, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies,

let me know, and I will do my best to make
it happen!

I’ll be posting lots of pictures of these
cute little Eggo Waffles on

Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram and Twitter. And
if you guys make them,

please take a picture and send it to me, I
love seeing your baking creations!
It just makes my day!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
